Operating Procedures
In accordance with Section 68.52 of the RMP rule, we use operating procedures to define how process-related job tasks assigned to our personnel should be performed. Procedures are maintained under the various management systems programs. 

Training
In accordance with Section 68.54 of the RMP rule, we train our employees to safely perform their assigned tasks. Our training program includes initial training as well as refresher training.

Maintenance
In accordance with Section 68.56 of the RMP rule, we maintain our process equipment using an inspection and testing program and we ensure that our equipment is designed and installed correctly so that it operates properly.

Compliance Audits
In accordance with Section 68.58 of the RMP rule, we conduct compliance audits to ensure that the facility is in compliance with the RMP rule. 

Incident Investigations
In accordance with Section 68.60 of the RMP rule, we perform incident investigations to help ensure that all incidents are thoroughly investigated, root causes are identified and corrected, and relevant findings are communicated throughout our organization to help prevent a recurrence. 

Five-year Accident History
On 9/29/2023, after pumping cyclohexylamine from a tote to the bulk tank, the hose was disconnected from the stinger and the contractor felt some drips fall on their arm. The contractor was wearing appropriate PPE The affected area was rinsed under a safety shower immediately and plant management was notified. The process for pulling the hose from the tote has been investigated and changed.

Emergency Response Program
ChemTreat is included in the Jefferson County Emergency Planning Commission community emergency response plan. ChemTreat coordinates any chemical release response actions with the Nederland Fire Department and has the appropriate mechanisms in pla

ystems, and wastewater systems. Hazardous and nonhazardous chemicals that are used in the blending process are stored in specifically designed and engineered storage and processing equipment. Chemicals are blended in a batch process into ChemTreat products which are distributed directly to using customers. The only regulated substance under the RMP rule used at the facility is cyclohexylamine.

Covered Process
The scope of the RMP covered process is limited to transfer and storage of cyclohexylamine in the bulk storage tank. No other processes occur where as threshold quantity of cyclohexylamine is managed.

Prevention Program
ChemTreat, Inc. takes a systematic approach to preventing accidental releases of hazardous chemicals. Our management systems address each of the key features of an accidental release prevention program including safety information, hazard review, operating procedures, training, preventive maintenance, compliance audits, and incident investigation. These individual elements of our operating procedures work together to prevent accidental chemical releases. ChemTreat, Inc. and our employees integrate these management systems into the way we do business and establish specific accountability for accident prevention into our process.

Safety Information
Risk identification begins early in the product stewardship process when every new raw material proposed for addition to process use is evaluated to determine the potential hazards of the material, compatibility with existing process components and all applicable regulatory constraints. The requirements to manage the risks associated with any new hazardous materials are determined and all necessary configuration changes, program procedure updates and employee training are completed prior to introduction of the new material into the process.

Executive Summary - Program 2

Background
ChemTreat's Risk Management Plan (RMP) is but one of many programs that have been developed to assure we carefully manage all potential hazards associated with the hazardous chemicals we use in our business with maximum concern for the safety and health of all employees, the community and the environment. All plant configuration, operations and emergency response practices are managed using company standard operating procedures which are a part of the Company Management Systems described below.

Quality System (QS)
Standard operating procedures for all production and related services are managed using an ISO 9000 certified Quality System. 
 
Environmental Management System (EMS)
All environmental program procedures are included in an Environmental Management System that is certified under the ISO 14001 Standard. The RMP is a program procedure under the EMS.
 
Health and Safety Management System (HSMS)
All Health and Safety written programs are already installed and controlled using the Management Systems same processes as ISO 9001 and ISO 14001 programs.

Policy
ChemTreat is well aware that our business requires the management of certain hazardous chemicals, which if not properly controlled, introduce increased potential for harm to employees, the community and the environment. Accordingly, we have established systematic procedures to evaluate potential risks, establish procedures to manage those risks on a priority basis, and review and update our programs as conditions or capabilities change. ChemTreat is committed to compliance with all regulatory and other requirements and uses a formal review process including internal and external auditing and inspection to assure the continuing suitability, adequacy and effectiveness of all compliance programs.
